section.name: OIL (Objects in a Line)
section.p:
OIL (Objects in a Lile) provides a queue API and its implementation which is required by many server applications which stores client requests permanently in order. OIL provides:
Queue which provides sequential access.
Index which provides random access based on java.util.Map

section.name: Features
section.p:
With OIL, you can:
Random-access queues: Useful for
Canceling scheduled requests
Searching queue items by specific key value
Embed persistent object store:
The default implementation provides thread-safe WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) persistance with high performance.
You can create your own implementation.
